contentrichtext.text: {{Other places3|Danilov (inhabited locality)}} {{Coord|58|11|N|40|10|E|type:city|display=title}} [[File:Danilov railway station in 2003.jpg|thumb|Town's railway station]] '''Danilov''' ({{lang-ru|Дани́лов}}) is a [[types of inhabited localities in Russia|town]] and the [[administrative center]] of [[Danilovsky District, Yaroslavl Oblast|Danilovsky District]] of [[Yaroslavl Oblast]], [[Russia]]. Population: {{ru-census|p2010=15,861|p2002=17,245|p1989=18,857}} ==History== Danilov was first mentioned in a chronicle in 1592, and was granted town status in 1777. ==Economy== There is a cheese producing plant and some other industries. There is also a major railway station where locomotives are switched from [[railway electrification system|electrification system]] DC 3kV to AC 25kV and vice versa. Railway lines go to [[Yaroslavl]], [[Vologda]], and [[Buy (town)|Buy]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Cities and towns in Yaroslavl Oblast}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2012}} [[Category:Cities and towns in Yaroslavl Oblast]]
